name: Automatiser le support informatique avec Telegram Voice vers des tickets JIRA en utilisant Whisper & GPT-4.1 Mini
description:
# 🎧 Bot d'automatisation du support vocal IT – Message vocal Telegram vers ticket JIRA avec OpenAI Whisper

> Traitez automatiquement les demandes de support informatique soumises via des messages vocaux Telegram en transcrivant, en extrayant des données structurées, en créant un ticket JIRA et en notifiant les parties concernées.

## 🧑‍💼 Pour qui est-ce

- Équipes internes qui gèrent le support informatique mais souhaitent rationaliser les demandes basées sur la voix.
- Employés qui préfèrent utiliser le mobile/la voix pour signaler des incidents ou demander de l'aide.
- Organisations cherchant à intégrer l'IA conversationnelle dans les flux de travail de support existants.

## ⚙️ Comment ça fonctionne / Ce que ça fait

1. Un utilisateur envoie un message vocal à un bot Telegram.
2. Le système vérifie s'il s'agit d'un message audio.
3. Si valide, l'audio est :
   - Téléchargé
   - Transcrit via OpenAI Whisper
   - Sauvegardé sur Google Drive
4. La transcription et les métadonnées du fichier sont fusionnées.
5. Le contenu fusionné est traité par un **Agent IA** (GPT) pour extraire des informations de demande structurées.
6. Un ticket JIRA est créé en utilisant les données extraites.
7. L'équipe informatique est notifiée via Slack (ou d'autres canaux).
8. Le demandeur reçoit un message de confirmation Telegram avec le lien du ticket JIRA.
9. Si l'entrée n'est pas audio, un message de rejet poli est envoyé.

## 📌 Fonctionnalités clés

- Prend en charge la création de tickets basée sur la voix
- Transcription précise utilisant Whisper
- Analyse des demandes contextuelles utilisant GPT-4.1 mini
- Création de tickets entièrement automatisée dans JIRA
- Notifie à la fois l'IT et le demandeur d'origine
- Sauvegarde cloud des messages vocaux originaux (Google Drive)

## 🛠️ Instructions d'installation
### Prérequis

| Composant | Requis |
|----------|----------|
| Clé API & Bot Telegram | ✅ |
| OpenAI Whisper / Modèle de transcription | ✅ |
| Identifiants Google Drive (OAuth2) | ✅ |
| Google Sheets ou autre stockage (optionnel) | ⬜ |
| Accès API JIRA Cloud | ✅ |
| Bot Slack ou Webhook | ✅ |

### Étapes du flux de travail

1. **Déclencheur de message vocal Telegram** : Démarre le flux lorsqu'un utilisateur envoie un message vocal.

2. **Est-ce un message audio ?** : Si faux → répondre "seul l'audio est pris en charge"

3. **Télécharger l'audio** : Télécharger le fichier `.oga` depuis Telegram.

4. **Transcrire l'audio** : Utiliser OpenAI Whisper pour obtenir la transcription textuelle.

5. **Sauvegarder sur Google Drive** : Télécharger le fichier vocal original avec les métadonnées.

6. **Fusionner les résultats** : Combiner la transcription et les métadonnées.

7. **Prétraiter la sortie** : Nettoyer le formatage avant l'extraction par l'IA.

8. **Agent de traitement de la transcription** : L'agent basé sur GPT extrait :
   - Nom du demandeur, département
   - Titre et description de la demande
   - Priorité et type de demande

9. **Soumettre le ticket de demande JIRA** : Créer un ticket à partir des données extraites par l'IA.

10. **Configurer Slack / Email / Étapes manuelles** : Routage interne ou approbations optionnelles.

11. **Informer le reporter via Telegram** : Envoie un message de confirmation avec le lien du ticket JIRA.

## 🔧 Comment personnaliser

- Remplacer JIRA par Zendesk, GitHub Issues ou d'autres outils de ticketing.
- Changer Slack en Microsoft Teams ou Email.
- Ajouter un journal Notion/Airtable.
- Améliorer l'agent pour extraire le département à partir de l'ID utilisateur ou des métadonnées.

## 📦 Exigences

| Intégration | Remarques |
|-------------|-------|
| Bot Telegram | Utilisé pour l'entrée/sortie |
| Google Drive | Sauvegarde audio |
| OpenAI GPT + Whisper | Transcription & Extraction |
| JIRA | Plateforme de ticketing |
| Slack | Notification d'équipe |

Construit avec ❤️ en utilisant [n8n](https://n8n.io)

nodes.name: Send message to IT Support team

parameters.content:
# 🎧 IT Voice Support Automation Bot – Telegram Voice Message to JIRA ticket with OpenAI Whisper

> Automatically process IT support requests submitted via Telegram voice messages by transcribing, extracting structured data, creating a JIRA ticket, and notifying relevant parties.

## 🧑‍💼 Who’s it for

- Internal teams that handle IT support but want to streamline voice-based requests.
- Employees who prefer using mobile/voice to report incidents or ask for support.
- Organizations aiming to integrate conversational AI into existing support workflows.

## ⚙️ How it works / What it does

1. A user sends a voice message to a Telegram bot.
2. The system checks whether it’s an audio message.
3. If valid, the audio is:
   - Downloaded
   - Transcribed via OpenAI Whisper
   - Backed up to Google Drive
4. The transcription and file metadata are merged.
5. The merged content is processed through an **AI Agent** (GPT) to extract structured request info.
6. A JIRA ticket is created using the extracted data.
7. The IT team is notified via Slack (or other channels).
8. The requester receives a Telegram confirmation message with the JIRA ticket link.
9. If the input is not audio, a polite rejection message is sent.

## 📌 Key Features

- Supports voice-based ticket creation
- Accurate transcription using Whisper
- Context-aware request parsing using GPT-4.1 mini
- Fully automated ticket creation in JIRA
- Notifies both IT and the original requester
- Cloud backup of original voice messages (Google Drive)

## 🛠️ Setup Instructions
### Prerequisites

| Component | Required |
|----------|----------|
| Telegram Bot & API Key | ✅ |
| OpenAI Whisper / Transcription Model | ✅ |
| Google Drive Credentials (OAuth2) | ✅ |
| Google Sheets or other storage (optional) | ⬜ |
| JIRA Cloud API Access | ✅ |
| Slack Bot or Webhook | ✅ |

### Workflow Steps

1. **Telegram Voice Message Trigger**: Starts the flow when a user sends a voice message.

2. **Is Audio Message?**: If false → reply "only voice is supported"

3. **Download Audio**: Download `.oga` file from Telegram.

4. **Transcribe Audio**: Use OpenAI Whisper to get text transcript.

5. **Backup to Google Drive**: Upload original voice file with metadata.

6. **Merge Results**: Combine transcript and metadata.

7. **Pre-process Output**: Clean formatting before AI extraction.

8. **Transcript Processing Agent**: GPT-based agent extracts:
   - Requester name, department
   - Request title & description
   - Priority & request type

9. **Submit JIRA Request Ticket**: Create ticket from AI-extracted data.

10. **Setup Slack / Email / Manual Steps**: Optional internal routing or approvals.

11. **Inform Reporter via Telegram**: Sends confirmation message with JIRA ticket link.

## 🔧 How to Customize

- Replace JIRA with Zendesk, GitHub Issues, or other ticketing tools.
- Change Slack to Microsoft Teams or Email.
- Add Notion/Airtable logging.
- Enhance agent to extract department from user ID or metadata.

## 📦 Requirements

| Integration | Notes |
|-------------|-------|
| Telegram Bot | Used for input/output |
| Google Drive | Audio backup |
| OpenAI GPT + Whisper | Transcript & Extraction |
| JIRA | Ticketing platform |
| Slack | Team notification |

Built with ❤️ using [n8n](https://n8n.io)

parameters.text:
=Sorry, I can’t read your input right now.
Please send me a voice message, and I’ll help you transcribe and track it! 🎙️💬

=Below is the voice message transcript sent to IT support. Please extract all relevant information according to your instructions.
---
{{ $json.toJsonString() }}
---

options.systemMessage:
=You are an intelligent IT Support Assistant.

Your job is to analyze voice message transcripts sent to the IT support team via Telegram, and extract all the key information required for internal processing.

Here’s what you must do:

1. Carefully read the entire transcript content of the voice message.
2. Determine the **actual requester** by checking:
   - If the speaker clearly mentions their **name, role, or department** during the voice message
   - If no identifying details are mentioned, leave the name and department fields blank (they can be filled in later manually)
3. Extract the following information:
   - Requester's name (if mentioned)
   - Requester's department or team (if mentioned)
   - Request category: choose from one of the following — *Feature, Incident, Access Request, Maintenance*
   - Priority level: *Low, Medium, High, or Critical*
   - Request title: a clear and concise title summarizing the main intent
   - Request description: provide enough technical and business context for the IT team to take action
   - Due date or urgency if mentioned
   - The full original transcript (for reference)

⚠️ Do not make up information that is not mentioned. If a specific field cannot be determined from the transcript, leave it blank or mark as "Not specified".

Return your output as **clearly structured data in text**, following a readable and organized format (not JSON). This will be converted to structured data by another tool.

parameters.text:
=*Dear {{ $('Transcript Processing Agent').item.json.output[0].requested_by.name }},*

Thank you for reaching out to the IT Support team.  
We’ve received your request regarding:  
*{{ $('Transcript Processing Agent').item.json.output[0].title }}*

📝 *Summary:*  
{{ $('Transcript Processing Agent').item.json.output[0].description }}

Your request has been successfully logged in our system and is now being processed by the IT Support team.

🔗 You can track the status of your request here:  
[{{ $('Submit JIRA request ticket').item.json.key }}]({{ $json["Jira base URL"] }}/browse/{{ $('Submit JIRA request ticket').item.json.key }})

Our team will review it shortly and follow up with any updates or actions needed.  

Best regards,  
*IT Support Team*

nodes.name: Backup Audio Message To Google Drive
Process output before feeding AI agent

parameters.content:
## 📥 1. Telegram Voice Input & Validation

### 🔹 Telegram Trigger
Listens for incoming messages via Telegram bot. This is the entry point of the workflow.

### 🔹 Is Audio Message?
Validates that the message is a voice/audio message. If not, it replies with a polite rejection ("Only voice messages are supported").

## 🎙️ 2. Audio Handling & Transcription

### 🔹 Download Audio Message
Retrieves the `.oga` file from Telegram for processing.

### 🔹 Transcribe Recording (OpenAI Whisper)
Sends the audio to OpenAI Whisper to generate a transcript of the voice message.

### 🔹 Backup Audio to Google Drive
Uploads the original audio message to Google Drive as a backup and reference.

## 🔀 3. Merge & Preprocess Data

### 🔹 Merge Transcript & Metadata
Combines the transcript and file metadata (e.g. Google Drive link, duration) into a single structured object.

### 🔹 Transform Output for AI Agent
Prepares and formats the merged data so it can be interpreted accurately by the AI agent.

## 🧠 4. AI-Powered Transcript Analysis
### 🔹 Transcript Processing Agent (GPT)
Analyzes the voice transcript using a GPT-based agent to extract structured IT support request data:
- Requester name, department
- Title & description
- Request type, priority, and urgency

## 🛠️ 5. Ticket Submission & Internal Notification
### 🔹 Submit JIRA Request Ticket
Creates a new JIRA issue using the extracted data from the AI agent.
### 🔹 Setup Jira, Slack, Email
Optional step to notify internal teams via Slack, email, or update manual logs with relevant info.

## 📬 6. User Confirmation
### 🔹 Inform Reporter via Telegram
Sends a personalized confirmation message to the original requester including:
- Summary of the request
- Ticket number
- Tracking link to JIRA

main.node: Process output before feeding AI agent
Backup Audio Message To Google Drive
Send message to IT Support team

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
